title: Ghats of Varanasi
description: Varanasi is known for its iconic ghats, where spirituality meets the Ganges. Each ghat has a unique story and significance.

ghats.name: Dashashwamedh Ghat
ghats.description: Dashaswamedh is a famous place on the banks of Ganga in Varanasi which has religious and historical importance. According to Kashikhand, Brahma , sent by Shiva , came to Kashi and performed ten Ashwamedha Yagyas here . According to Shivrahasya, earlier there was Rudrasarovar here, but after the journey of Ganga, its boundaries were formed by Gangapaar in the east, Dashreshwar in the south, Agastyakund in the west and Somnath in the north. There is a temple of Prayageshwar here. According to Kashi Prasad Jaiswal , this is the land where the Bharshiv Rajbhar kings performed ten Ashwamedha Yagyas. In 1929, many Yagya Kunds were found during excavation below the temple of Rani Putiya. It is mandatory to take a bath here on Tritirthi.

ghats.name: Assi Ghat
ghats.description: Popular among tourists and locals, Assi Ghat is a peaceful place for yoga and sunrise views.

ghats.name: Manikarnika Ghat
ghats.description: One of the most sacred ghats, believed to be a gateway to Moksha.
